I've eaten at some nice places.  Eleven Madison, Le Cirque, Nobu, Gary Danko, Breslin, NoMa, and Sushi Yasuda to name a few.  I can assure you this place is at least worth two michelin stars, definitely more than 1!  At 25€ for 3 courses it's a bargain as it includes a liter of sangria and a glass of cava for two.  Frankly I was blown away.  While the chef described the cuisine as "comfort food," our iberico con asparagus, razor clams, black sea bass and beef stew were full of flavor and life!  Bottom line, don't miss this stop in Barcelona and come early in your trip as you may want to return before you leave the city.
